title: Probing Ferroelastic Strain and Stacking Orders in van der Waals Ferroelectrics via Multi-modal 4D-STEM
content: Van der Waals (vdW) ferroelectrics (FE) are at the forefront of nano-electronic innovation, with their special structure enabling polarization that's intricately tied to both in-plane lattice strain and out-of-plane stacking order, directly influencing their electronic properties [1]. While conventional scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) achieves atomic resolution, it falls short in simultaneously depicting strain and stacking in van der Waals materials. To address this, we utilized dual 4D-STEM modalities: nanobeam diffraction and multislice ptychography, to map out micron-scale domain structures and atomic layer configurations with varying stacking sequences of the 2D vdW SnSe.
